page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: {Holford Hall}(ref.SJ 709755) dating from around 1600, is a listed historic building, built by Lady Mary Cholmondeley. It replaced an earlier hall situated nearer to Watling Street. One wing of the moated hall remains and is occupied. It is now used as a farmhouse. The building is a timber-framed black and white lath and plaster structure, typical of Cheshire's "magpie" buildings. There is still evidence of the nearby grain mill. Parts of the wheel mechanism remain, also the mill race, though the mill pond and the mill itself no longer exist.
